The encryption algorithm [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RC4 RC4], which was very widely used for a long time, has been regarded as insecure for many years. Security experts know many critical flaws that have been used for cyber attacks. In 2015, the IETF (Internet Engineering Task Force) prohibited the use of RC4 for [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transport_Layer_Security TLS connections] in [https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7465 RFC7465]. [https://www.golem.de/news/ietf-rc4-in-tls-offiziell-nicht-mehr-erlaubt-15 02-112469.html RC4 in TLS officially no longer allowed (Golem.de - German only]
